title: Why have so few US presidents been assassinated? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: So few? Lincoln, Garfield, McKinley, Kennedy. That’s four in less than 300 years. I don’t consider that few. Plus, we have the attempts…FDR, TDR, Truman, Reagan, Ford. There but for poor marksmanship. That’s off the top of my head.

Four of your presidents have been assassinated. That’s not a lot to you? I don’t know about other countries, but Canada has had no PM’s killed. One political murder back in the day, Thomas D’arcy MaGee. Don’t remember why. Even the British don’t have that many, I don’t think. All I can remember is the bomber, in the Parliament building. Guy Fawkes! That’s the guy. Hey Commonwealth, help me out here….
